Authorizes the Office to address issues and implement solutions to improve wellness and resilience, including issues and solutions identified by the Trauma-Informed Care Task Force. Appropriates moneys. Sunsets on an unspecified date.

1824.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Twenty-seventh Representative District.
1824.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the twenty-seventh representative district.

1825.last_action: Referred to ECD, CPC/JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
1825.title: Relating To Sports Wagering.
1825.description: Allows for the regulation of sports wagering by the department of business, economic development, and tourism. Establishes licensing requirements for sports wagering operators and sports wagering suppliers. Specifies that sports wagering shall not be considered games of chance or gambling.

1827.last_action: The committee(s) on FIN recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1827.title: Relating To Healthcare Preceptors.
1827.description: Clarifies the limits of when a preceptor may be compensated for standard clinical services while providing a volunteer-based supervised clinical training rotation. Amends the definition of "preceptor" to improve accessibility for providers to receive income tax credits for acting as preceptors. Includes the director of health on the preceptor credit assurance committee. Effective 7/1/2060. (HD1)

1829.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Eli, Kapela excused (2).
1829.title: Relating To Dental Assistants.
1829.description: Allows dental assistants to perform limited duties under general supervision of a licensed dentist in public health settings. Effective 7/1/2060. (HD2)

1830.title: Relating To The Hawaii Property Insurance Association.
1830.description: Short form bill relating to the Hawaii Property Insurance Association.

1831.title: Relating To Habitat Conservation Plans.
1831.description: Requires any person, before engaging in an activity with a high likelihood of resulting in an incidental take of a threatened or endangered species, to enter into a planning process with DLNR for the purpose of preparing and implementing a habitat conservation plan. Requires habitat conservation plans to include additional components. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD2)

1832.last_action: Notice of intent to veto (Gov. Msg. No. 1216)
1832.title: Relating To Telephonic Services.
1832.description: Permits, but does not require or prohibit, medicaid, health insurers, mutual benefit societies, and health maintenance organizations to cover telephonic behavioral health services under certain circumstances. Clarifies that telephonic services do not constitute telehealth. (CD1)

1833.last_action: Referred to WAL/LAT, FIN, referral sheet 3
1833.title: Relating To The Pupukea Marine Life Conservation District.
1833.description: Requires the Department of Land and Natural Resources to establish and conduct the Pupukea marine life conservation district carrying capacity pilot program. Appropriates moneys.

1834.title: Relating To Taxes.
1834.description: Beginning 1/1/2023, requires every person making payment to a loan-out company and claiming the motion picture, digital media, and film production income tax credit to withhold and remit to DOTAX a portion of all payments to the loan-out company; increases the amount of the tax credit; amends the requirements to claim the tax credit, including reducing the amount of qualified productions costs; removes the requirement for productions to submit a verification review by a qualified certified public accountant when applying for the tax credit; requires the report by DBEDT to include the dollar amount claimed, name of the company, and name of the qualified production of the taxpayer; changes the time frame for DBEDT to issue a letter to the taxpayer claiming the tax credit; increases the cap of the claimable amount of the tax credit; requires taxpayers to submit a fee to DBEDT; and clarifies the definition of "qualified production costs". Extends the period during which excess income tax credits may be claimed to 12/31/2032. Authorizes, and appropriates funds for, DOTAX to establish 2 full-time equivalent tax auditor positions. Requires, and appropriates funds for, DBEDT to establish 1 full-time equivalent program specialist position. (CD1)

1836.last_action: Referred to AGR/WAL, CPC, referral sheet 3
1836.title: Relating To Substances Applied On State Property.
1836.description: Establishes a list of substances allowed for use as pesticides and fertilizers on state property. Provides that the use of substances not specifically allowed as pesticides and fertilizers on state property is prohibited, unless certain exceptions, a waiver, or exemption apply. Requires a state department or agency seeking a waiver to apply to the department of agriculture. Effective July 1, 2023.

1837.last_action: Referred to HHH/LAT, CPC, referral sheet 3
1837.title: Relating To Limitations On Mandatory Overtime For Nurses.
1837.description: Establishes limitations on mandatory and voluntary overtime for registered nurses and licensed practical nurses. Effective 1/1/2023.

1841.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Eli, Kapela excused (2).
1841.title: Relating To The Hawaii Youth Conservation Corps.
1841.description: Amends the age requirement for participation in the green jobs youth corps program. Appropriates funds for administration of the program. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1847.last_action: Re-referred to AGR, FIN, referral sheet 5
1847.title: Relating To Capital Improvements.
1847.description: Amends the definition of "capital investment costs" to include the planting of trees having an expected lifespan of at least 15 years.

1848.title: Relating To Non-general Fund Reports.
1848.description: Amends the contents required to be submitted in each annual nongeneral fund program measures report and non-general fund cost element report. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1849.title: Relating To The Emergency And Budget Reserve Fund.
1849.description: Appropriates funds into the emergency and budget reserve fund.

1850.last_action: Referred to EDN, FIN, referral sheet 3
1850.title: Relating To The Issuance Of Special Purpose Revenue Bonds To Assist Saint Joseph School.
1850.description: Authorizes the issuance of special purpose revenue bonds to assist Saint Joseph School in planning, designing, constructing, reconstructing, renovating, acquiring, equipping, and improving educational facilities.

1857.last_action: The committee(s) on GVR/LMG recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1857.title: Relating To A Whistleblower Hotline.
1857.description: Requires the ombudsman to establish and manage a hotline by which an employee, or a person acting on behalf of an employee, may contact the office of the ombudsman directly to report a violation or suspected violation of a law, rule, ordinance, or regulation, or a contract executed by the State, a political subdivision of the State, or the United States. Authorizes the ombudsman to receive and investigate reports of violations or suspected violations from the whistleblower hotline.

1860.title: Relating To Government Operations.
1860.description: Short form bill relating to government operations.

1861.last_action: Referred to PDP/HSG, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
1861.title: Relating To Foreclosing On Mortgaged Property.
1861.description: Seeks to prohibit under legal penalties the foreclosure of rental properties, both residential and commercial, during a state of emergency for public health crises.

1862.last_action: Referred to JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
1862.title: Relating To Native Hawaiian Trust Beneficiaries.
1862.description: Seeks to ensure the State of Hawaii promptly and completely render the full amount owed to the plaintiffs in the case of Kalima v. State upon the final calculation of damages owed.

1864.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For Kaiser High School.
1864.description: Request for funding for Kaiser High School capital improvement projects to modernize infrastructure; plan, design, and build model of an on-campus complex for visual and performing arts; and improve the Kaiser athletics complex.

1865.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
1865.title: Relating To School Gardens.
1865.description: Establishes a school garden coordinator position within the department of education. Appropriates funds for the position and related expenses. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1866.last_action: Referred to TRN, EDN, FIN, referral sheet 3
1866.title: Relating To Safe Routes To School.
1866.description: Establishes the safe routes to school advisory committee within the Planning Branch of the Highways Division of the Department of Transportation. Appropriates moneys.

1868.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
1868.title: Relating To The Sand Island State Recreation Area.
1868.description: Appropriates funds to the Department of Land and Natural Resources to prepare a master plan for the Sand Island State Recreation Area. (SD1)

1869.last_action: Referred to JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
1869.title: Relating To Pretrial Release.
1869.description: Establishes a presumption that a person charged with a crime is entitled to unconditional release unless proven otherwise. Requires the consideration of nonfinancial conditions of release before bail is ordered.

1870.last_action: Referred to HSG, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
1870.title: Relating To Affordable Housing At Aloha Stadium.
1870.description: Requires the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation to develop a plan to build affordable housing at the Aloha Stadium site.

1878.title: Relating To Chapter 92, Hawaii Revised Statutes.
1878.description: Defines "board business" and "informal gatherings". Allows a board to prepare and circulate amongst members a statement on a position previously adopted for purposes of submission to the legislature, under certain circumstances. Outlines when board packets must be available to interested persons. (SD1)

1879.title: Relating To Island Burial Councils.
1879.description: Short form bill relating to island burial councils.

1882.last_action: Referred to HHH/EEP, CPC, referral sheet 3
1882.title: Relating To The Red Hill Storage Tanks.
1882.description: Requires the Department of Health to adopt rules for underground storage tanks and tank systems that are more stringent than federal underground storage tank regulations. Establishes the Red Hill Task Force to study the implementation of containment measures at, or the elimination of, underground storage tanks at Red Hill.

1897.last_action: Referred to CMV, JHA, referral sheet 3
1897.title: Relating To The Military.
1897.description: Changes the definition of qualified applicants for selective services from male to all.

1898.last_action: Referred to LAT, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
1898.title: Relating To Hawaii Retirement Savings.
1898.description: Establishes the Hawaii Retirement Savings Program, administered by the Hawaii Retirement Savings Board, in consultation with the Department of Budget and Finance and Department of Labor and Industrial Relations, to provide a state-facilitated payroll-deduction automatic enrollment individual retirement plan to private sector employees who do not have access to employer-sponsored retirement savings plans beginning 7/1/2024. Appropriates funds.

1900.last_action: Referred to EEP, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
1900.title: Relating To Clean Energy.
1900.description: Establishes a property assessed clean energy program to promote renewable energy systems and energy efficiency improvements. Increases a property's tax assessment to make loan payments. Authorizes the issuance of revenue bonds and appropriates bond revenues to finance the program.

1902.last_action: Referred to HET, JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
1902.title: Proposing An Amendment To The State Constitution Establishing The Right To Own One's Own Data.
1902.description: Proposes to amend Article 1 of the Hawaii Constitution by establishing the right of each person to own and have an exclusive property right in the data they generate on the Internet.

1903.last_action: Re-referred to HET, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 6
1903.title: Relating To Consumer Privacy.
1903.description: Establishes the Hawaii consumer privacy act. Specifies various consumer rights with respect to the collection of personal information by businesses. Outlines the obligations on businesses with respect to the collection, disclosure, sharing, and selling of consumer personal information. Specifies the requirements for administration and enforcement by the department, including adoption of rules. Appropriates funds. Effective 1/1/2023.

1904.last_action: Referred to HET, JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
1904.title: Relating To Cybersecurity.
1904.description: Prohibits government agencies, business entities, and health care entities in the State from paying or having another entity pay on its behalf ransom for cyber incidents or cyber ransom or ransomware attacks. Requires all agencies and entities to report incidents and attacks to the office of homeland security. Establishes penalties for violations. Requires the director of homeland security to develop and maintain a list of all incidents and attacks and make the list available to the public. Appropriates funds.

1907.last_action: Referred to HHH, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
1907.title: Relating To The Department Of Human Services.
1907.description: Appropriates funding for the med-QUEST program of the department of human services (program identification number HMS401) for non-covered or under-covered behavioral health services for med-QUEST beneficiaries.

1910.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
1910.title: Relating To The Waianae Coast Comprehensive Health Center Emergency Department.
1910.description: Appropriates funds to the Department of Health to procure services from the Waianae Coast Comprehensive Health Center for the public purpose of operating a twenty-four-hour, year-round emergency department to serve the residents of the Waianae coast. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

1911.last_action: The committee(s) on WAL recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1911.title: Relating To Flood Mitigation.
1911.description: Appropriates funds for flood mitigation measures at Makaha Valley and Lualualei, based on structural and nonstructural measures recommended in studies previously conducted.

1912.last_action: Referred to JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
1912.title: Relating To The Department Of Hawaiian Home Lands.
1912.description: Requires the Hawaii Tourism Authority to prepare a form to be distributed to all travelers to Hawaii informing them of the mission of the department of Hawaiian home lands and including an option to contribute a sum earmarked for the development of infrastructure and residential lots on Hawaiian home lands.

1918.last_action: The committee(s) on GVR recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1918.title: Relating To Joint Contractor Or Subcontractor Listing.
1918.description: Clarifies the listing of joint contractors and subcontractors required for construction bids under section 103D-302, Hawaii Revised Statues.

1922.last_action: Referred to HET, JHA , referral sheet 3
1922.title: Relating To Information Privacy And Security Council.
1922.description: Amends section 487N-5(a), Hawaii Revised Statutes, to allow for each member of the Information Privacy and Security Council to designate a designee to act on the member's behalf in order to ensure quorum.

1923.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott excused (1).
1923.title: Relating To Purchases Of Health And Human Services.
1923.description: Authorizes heads of purchasing agencies to issue requests for statement of qualifications and to establish lists of qualified providers for treatment purchase of services. Increases the small purchase threshold for purchases of health and human services. Abolishes the community council on purchase of health and human services. Effective 7/1/2112. (HD1)

1926.title: Relating To Credit For Time Of Detention Prior To Sentence.
1926.description: Clarifies that defendants shall not earn credit on a sentence imposed for a subsequent conviction for time being served on a previous felony conviction. (SD1)

1928.last_action: Postponed Indefinitely with 47 Ayes Representative(s) Aquino, Belatti, Branco, Clark, Costales, Eli, Ganaden, Gates, Har, Hashem, Hashimoto, Ichiyama, Ilagan, Johanson, Kapela, Kitagawa, B. Kobayashi, D. Kobayashi, Kong, LoPresti, Lowen, Luke, Matayoshi, Matsumoto, McDermott, McKelvey, Mizuno, Morikawa, Nakamura, Nakashima, Nishimoto, Okimoto, Onishi, Perruso, Quinlan, Saiki, Sayama, Takayama, Takumi, Tam, Tarnas, Todd, Ward, Wildberger, Woodson, Yamane, Yamashita; 0 Noes none; and 4 Excused Representative(s) Holt, Marten, Ohno, Tokioka.
1928.title: Relating To Tobacco Manufacturer Qualified Escrow Funds.
1928.description: Provides a mechanism to assign nonparticipating tobacco manufacturers' qualified escrow fund balances to the State. Provides a mechanism for the financial institution acting as the escrow agent of the qualified escrow fund to petition the courts to authorize transfer of funds to the State when the qualified escrow fund is abandoned. (SD2)

1929.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) Har, Kapela, Matayoshi, Matsumoto, McKelvey, Okimoto, Perruso, Todd, Tokioka voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott excused (1).
1929.title: Relating To Employees Of The Department Of The Attorney General.
1929.description: Converts the positions of the administrator of the Hawaii criminal justice data center and the chief special investigator of the department of the attorney general from civil service status to exempt status. Effective 1/1/2222. (HD1)

1930.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott excused (1).
1930.title: Making An Emergency Appropriation To The Department Of The Attorney General.
1930.description: Makes an emergency appropriation to the department of the attorney general for use in major litigation involving the State. Effective 1/1/2222. (HD1)

1931.last_action: The committee(s) on PDP recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1931.title: Relating To Sovereign Immunity.
1931.description: Amends section 662-15, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to provide that chapter 662 shall not apply to any claim that an act or omission caused or contributed to, directly or indirectly, a person contracting coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) or its variants. Provides for retroactive application to January 1, 2020. Provides that any waiver of sovereign immunity with respect to claims that an act or omission caused or contributed to, directly or indirectly, an individual contracting COVID-19 or its variants that accrued on or after January 1, 2020, is expressly withdrawn.

1933.last_action: The committee(s) on LAT recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1933.title: Relating To Employer Information.
1933.description: Amends section 201-13.8, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to allow the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism to collect and analyze employer information and data.

1936.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDC/WAM.
1936.title: Relating To Important Agricultural Lands.
1936.description: Allows landowners and lessees of important agricultural lands to apply to the counties to develop, construct, and maintain farm cluster housing on the lands for rent to farmers and farm employees who actively and currently farm on the land, subject to certain exemptions. Removes restrictions on farm dwellings on important agricultural lands that are stricter than that for farm dwellings within agricultural districts. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

1937.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
1937.title: Proposing Amendments To Article Vii, Sections 12 And 13, Of The Hawaii Constitution To Expressly Provide That The Legislature May Authorize The Counties To Issue Tax Increment Bonds And To Exclude Tax Increment Bonds From Determinations Of The Funded Debt Of The Counties.
1937.description: Proposes amendments to the Constitution of the State of Hawaii to expressly provide that the legislature may authorize political subdivisions, such as counties, to issue tax increment bonds and to exclude tax increment bonds in calculating the debt limit of the political subdivisions.

1939.last_action: Referred to ECD, FIN, referral sheet 3
1939.title: Relating To The Motion Picture, Digital Media, And Film Production Income Tax Credit.
1939.description: Extends current sunset date of the motion picture, digital media, and film production income tax credit from January 1, 2026, to January 1, 2032.

1940.title: Relating To Financing.
1940.description: Creates a commercial property assessed financing program under the administration of the Hawaii Green Infrastructure Authority. Allows commercial property owners to finance qualifying improvements through a non-ad valorem special property tax assessment. (SD2)

1941.title: Relating To Renewable Portfolio Standards.
1941.description: Amends the definition of "renewable portfolio standard" to mean a percentage of electrical energy generation, rather than sales, excluding customer-sited fossil fuel generation. Expands the events or circumstances that are beyond an electric utility company's reasonable control to include non-renewable energy generated by electric generation facilities over or of which the electric utility does not have direct control or ownership. Requires electric utility companies to track and annually report data and trends on customer retention and attrition to further inform the calculation of the renewable portfolio standards. Effective 7/1/2022. (SD2)

1942.last_action: The committee on TRS deferred the measure.
1942.title: Relating To Zero Emission Transportation.
1942.description: Establishes a zero-emission vehicle rebate program within the public utilities commission to enable low- and moderate-income families greater access to zero-emission vehicles by providing a rebate on the point-of-sale purchase price of zero-emission vehicles. Effective 7/1/2100. (HD2)

1954.title: Relating To The Hawaii Employer-union Health Benefits Trust Fund Medicare Part B Premium Reimbursement.
1954.description: Excludes medicare income related monthly adjustment amounts reimbursement by the State and counties for retired employees hired after June 30, 2022, and their spouses. Effective 12/25/2040. (HD1)

1955.title: Relating To The Hawaii Employer-union Health Benefits Trust Fund Spousal Medicare Part B Premium Reimbursement.
1955.description: Excludes medicare part B premium reimbursement by the State and counties for the spouses of retired employees hired after June 30, 2022. Effective 12/25/2040. (HD1)

1956.last_action: The committee(s) on FIN recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1956.title: Relating To The Hawaii Employer-union Health Benefits Trust Fund Investments.
1956.description: Exempts the Hawaii Employer-Union Health Benefits Trust Fund from disclosing under chapter 92F, Hawaii Revised Statutes, certain types of alternative investment fund information. Effective 12/25/2040. (HD1)

1957.title: Relating To Employees' Retirement System Disability Retirement.
1957.description: Clarifies the Employees' Retirement System's eligibility requirement definitions for service-connected disability and accidental death benefits. Effective 12/25/2040. (HD1)

1958.last_action: The committee(s) on FIN recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1958.title: Making An Appropriation To The Emergency And Budget Reserve Fund.
1958.description: Makes a general fund appropriation for fiscal year 2021-2022 to further capitalize the Emergency and Budget Reserve Fund.

1959.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McKelvey excused (1).
1959.title: Relating To Franchise Tax.
1959.description: Ensures that the $2,000,000 franchise tax payment is credited in full to the compliance resolution fund for use by the division of financial institutions. Specifies that if franchise tax collections are insufficient, the difference will be derived from income tax collections. Clarifies that franchise tax revenues in excess of $2,000,000 shall be deposited into the general fund. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD1)

1960.last_action: Conference committee meeting to reconvene on 04-29-22 1:30PM; Conference Room 224.
1960.title: Relating To Special Purpose Digital Currency Licensure.
1960.description: Establishes a program for the licensure, regulation, and oversight of digital currency companies. (SD2)

1961.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
1961.title: Relating To The Barbering And Cosmetology Licensing Act.
1961.description: Adds and updates definitions to satisfy current industry practice needs; aligns and remedies inconsistencies between chapters 438 and 439, Hawaii Revised Statutes; removes the five-year license requirement for barber and beauty operator board of barbering and cosmetology member seats; raises fees for penalties and disciplinary actions; and removes medical clearance requirements. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD2)

1962.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JHA with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Eli, Kapela excused (2).
1962.title: Relating To Advance Warning For Excavation.
1962.description: Applies the existing advance warning requirements to excavators operating on residential properties and locators. Specifies the situations that trigger the requirement to notify emergency services and minimize a hazard. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD1)

1964.title: Relating To Credit For Reinsurance.
1964.description: Amends the provisions in the insurance code relating to bilateral agreements on insurance and reinsurance for consistency with the agreements between the United States and European Union and the United States and United Kingdom. (SD1)

1965.title: Relating To Money Transmitters.
1965.description: Minimizes regulatory burden and eliminates redundancy by permitting money transmitter applicants to submit to either a state or federal criminal history record check, rather than both. (SD1)

1966.last_action: The committee on CPN deferred the measure.
1966.title: Relating To Mortgage Rescue Fraud.
1966.description: Amends the definitions of a "distressed property consultant" and "mortgage assistance relief service" in the mortgage rescue fraud prevention act. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD1)

1967.title: Relating To Mortgage Servicers.
1967.description: Authorizes the Commissioner of Financial Institutions to modify or waive requirements relating to mortgage servicers in chapter 454M, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to implement changes and improvements made to the NMLS. (SD1)

1968.last_action: Referred to LAT, CPC, referral sheet 3
1968.title: Relating To The Elevator Mechanics Licensing Board Composition.
1968.description: Amends the composition of the Elevator Mechanics Licensing Board to replace the ex-officio Department of Labor and Industrial Relations member with a licensed elevator mechanic member.

1969.last_action: The committee(s) on JHA recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1969.title: Relating To The Hawaii Code Of Military Justice.
1969.description: Updates the Hawaii Code of Military Justice, by repealing chapter 124A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, and adding a new chapter to promote order and discipline in the State Military Forces by fostering an independent military justice system and updating nonjudicial punishment and courts-martial procedures. Effective 7/1/3000. (HD1)

1971.last_action: Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 883).
1971.title: Relating To The Emergency Management Assistance Compact.
1971.description: Creates a new Emergency Management Assistance Compact. Repeals the existing Emergency Management Assistance Compact. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

1974.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, Ward excused (2).
1974.title: Relating To Federal Indirect Overhead Reimbursements.
1974.description: Broadens the purposes for which indirect costs incurred by the department of education, state public charter school commission, or a charter authorizer from federal grants may be reimbursed. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1975.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, Ward excused (2).
1975.title: Relating To Options For Students In Department Of Education Schools.
1975.description: Broadens the scope of profit-making operations students may engage in at schools to include commercial enterprises; provided that engagement in commercial enterprises shall be related to the primary educational purposes of the school, career pathway, academy, or program. Allows students to receive school credit, compensation, or both, when they engage in profit-making operations. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1976.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) Okimoto, Ward voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott excused (1).
1976.title: Relating To Commercial Enterprises In Schools.
1976.description: Deems student interns engaging in commercial enterprises to be employees of the State. Allows the department of education to use revenue from commercial enterprises. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1977.last_action: The committee on EDU deferred the measure.
1977.title: Relating To Official School Business.
1977.description: Requires DOE and BOE to take certain steps to better address harassment of its employees. Creates the offense of harassment of an educational worker for disrupting or interfering with the administration or functions of any school, school administration office, or school board. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD2)

1978.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott excused (1).
1978.title: Making An Emergency Appropriation To The Department Of Education For A Virtual School.
1978.description: Makes an emergency appropriation for a department of education virtual school and authorizes the director of finance to issue general obligation bonds. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1979.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, Ward excused (2).
1979.title: Making An Emergency Appropriation To The Department Of Education For A Maintenance Base Yard.
1979.description: Authorizes the issuance of general obligation bonds to provide for an emergency appropriation for the department of education to build a new maintenance base yard. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1980.last_action: Referred to AGR, EDN, FIN, referral sheet 3
1980.title: Making An Emergency Appropriation To The Department Of Education For An Agriculture Innovation Center.
1980.description: Provides an emergency appropriation for the department of education to build an agriculture innovation center.

1981.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on LAT with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Luke, McDermott excused (2).
1981.title: Relating To Professional Development For Teachers.
1981.description: Provides an appropriation for the department of education to provide twenty-one additional hours of professional development for teachers. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1982.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott excused (1).
1982.title: Making An Emergency Appropriation To The Department Of Education For Lead Abatement.
1982.description: Makes an emergency appropriation for lead abatement measures at department of education elementary schools. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1983.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Tokioka excused (1).
1983.title: Relating To Earned Income Tax Credit.
1983.description: Extends the availability of the state earned income tax credit until tax year 2028.

1984.last_action: Referred to ECD, FIN, referral sheet 3
1984.title: Relating To Constitutional Tax Refund For Resident Taxpayers..
1984.description: Creates a one-time income tax refund for resident taxpayers that shall be refunded to implement the provision of article VII, section 6, of the Constitution of the State of Hawaii.

1985.last_action: Referred to JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
1985.title: Relating To Tax Exemption.
1985.description: Exempts any homestead development for the Department of Hawaiian Home Lands from general excise taxes.

1988.last_action: The committee(s) on GVR recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1988.title: Relating To Interim Administrative Rules Of The Department Of Hawaiian Home Lands.
1988.description: Allows the Department of Hawaiian Home Lands after beneficiary consultation and upon approval by the Hawaiian Homes Commission to issue interim rules that shall be exempt from the public notice, public hearing, and gubernatorial approval requirements of chapter 91, Hawaii Revised Statutes. The interim rules shall be effective for not more than eighteen months.

1989.last_action: Referred to JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
1989.title: Relating To Adoption.
1989.description: Allows an adopted individual to benefit both by relationship through a natural parent and through an adoptive parent in a disposition or other designation as provided for in accordance with the Hawaiian Homes Commission Act, 1920, as amended, or administrative rules. Allows the adopted individual and individual's natural family to continue having the same familial relationship.

1990.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) McKelvey, Todd voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Kapela, Perruso voting no (2) and none excused (0).
1990.title: Relating To Exemptions From Civil Service For Positions In The Department Of Human Services.
1990.description: Permanently exempts eight specified positions in the department of human services from civil service. Effective 7/1/2060. (HD1)

1992.last_action: Referred to HHH, FIN, referral sheet 3
1992.title: Relating To Ohana Zones.
1992.description: Extends the Ohana Zones pilot program to June 30, 2026. Appropriates funds.

1993.title: Relating To Reports To The Legislature For The Department Of Human Services.
1993.description: Removes outdated reporting requirements for the Department of Human Services, including the Office of Youth Services. (SD2)

1994.last_action: Referred to HHH, FIN, referral sheet 3
1994.title: Relating To Child Care Grant Programs Of The Department Of Human Services.
1994.description: Renames the Preschool Grant Program Special Fund to the Child Care Grant Program Special Fund, authorizes the Child Care Grant Program Special Fund to be used to give grants to child care facilities, adds federal funds as one of the fund sources for the Child Care Grant Program Special Fund, changes the legislative report due date for the Preschool Open Doors Special Fund and Child Care Grant Program Special Fund from August 31 to twenty days prior to the start of the next legislative session, and deletes the authority to expend without an appropriation for the Preschool Open Doors Special Fund and Child Care Grant Program Special Fund statutes to conform to section 5 of article VII of the Hawaii State Constitution.

1995.last_action: Referred to HHH, FIN, referral sheet 3
1995.title: Relating To Family Resource Centers.
1995.description: Establishes the Family Resource Centers Pilot Program, establishes one FTE Family Resource Centers Coordinator position, and appropriates funds.

1996.last_action: Referred to HHH, JHA, referral sheet 3
1996.title: Relating To Background Checks.
1996.description: Authorizes state and national criminal history checks for current and prospective employees, volunteers, and contractors and their employees, agents, and volunteers who are in positions that require close proximity to children, young adults, or vulnerable adults receiving child welfare services, social services, or certain other benefits and services from the department. Makes non-substantial conforming amendments to sections 345-2.5 and 846-2.7, Hawaii Revised Statutes. Effective upon approval.

1997.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
1997.title: Relating To Kupuna Care Program.
1997.description: Incorporates the kupuna caregivers program into the kupuna care program and adds services for care recipients, caregivers, and employed caregivers. Effective 7/1/2060. (HD1)

1998.title: Relating To Marriage Licenses.
1998.description: Establishes a fee for all licenses to solemnize a marriage. Allows DOH to increase the fee, subject to certain requirements. Requires DOH to account for the collection and deposit of the fee. Repeals the expiration of and fees specific to civil licenses to solemnize marriages. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD2)

1999.title: Relating To Municipal Solid Waste Landfill Permits.
1999.description: Reinstates the Department of Health's authority to permit federal municipal solid waste landfills. (HD1)

2000.title: Relating To Water Pollution Control.
2000.description: Adds, amends, and reorganizes sections in chapter 342D, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to consolidate water quality certification requirements and include wetlands in the definition of "state waters". Clarifies the director of health's responsibility as a certifying agency. Increases maximum statutory civil penalties to match the amounts of federal penalties and the state penalty. Effective 1/1/2222. (HD2)

2001.last_action: Re-referred to HHH, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 6
2001.title: Relating To Newborn Hearing Screening And Diagnosis.
2001.description: Amends the newborn hearing screening statute to mandate reporting of diagnostic audiologic evaluation results to improve hearing follow-up of infants. Updates definitions and terminology.

2006.last_action: Referred to HHH, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
2006.title: Relating To Act 212, Session Laws Of Hawaii 2021.
2006.description: Extends the deadline to complete the transfer of the Oahu regional health care system from the Hawaii Health Systems Corporation to the Department of Health. Appropriates moneys.

2008.last_action: Referred to HHH/EEP, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
2008.title: Making An Emergency Appropriation To The Department Of Health For Costs Resulting From The Release Of Petroleum From The Red Hill Bulk Fuel Storage Facility.
2008.description: Makes an emergency appropriation to the Department of Health for response activities and enforcement relating to the petroleum leaks at the Red Hill Bulk Fuel Storage Facility.

2009.last_action: Referred to PDP/HHH, FIN, referral sheet 3
2009.title: Making An Emergency Appropriation To The Department Of Health For Covid-19 Vaccinations.
2009.description: Makes an emergency appropriation to provide funds to support COVID vaccination activities. Effective upon approval.

2010.last_action: Report adopted; referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Eli, Kapela excused (2).
2010.title: Relating To The Boiler And Elevator Safety Law.
2010.description: Allows the director of labor and industrial relations to permit owner-user inspectors in the exclusive employment of owner-user inspection organizations to perform inspections on pressure retaining items. Extends the time from ten to thirteen years for the director to reimburse the general fund from the boiler and elevator revolving fund. Effective 12/25/2040. (HD1)

2012.last_action: Referred to LAT, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
2012.title: Elating To The Adequate Reserve Fund.
2012.description: Amends the definition of "adequate reserve fund" to exclude the benefit cost rate from June 2020 through August 2021 effective from 2023 to 2030.

2014.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McKelvey excused (1).
2014.title: Relating To Transferability Of Mooring Permits.
2014.description: Allows a holder of a mooring permit within a state small boat harbor to transfer the mooring permit under certain terms and conditions. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2015.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) Ganaden, Lowen, Marten, Perruso, Tam voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Kapela voting no (1) and Representative(s) McKelvey excused (1).
2015.title: Relating To A State Boating Facility Lease Program.
2015.description: Establishes a state boating facility lease pilot program within the department of land and natural resources. Clarifies that a private partner under lease with the department may assist with development, management, and maintenance of a state boating facility. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2017.last_action: The committee(s) on WAL recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2017.title: Relating To Disposition Of Public Lands By Negotiation.
2017.description: Includes leases for commercial, industrial, and hotel or resort purposes eligible for disposition by negotiation pursuant to section 171-59(b), Hawaii Revised Statutes.

2018.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Tokioka excused (1).
2018.title: Relating To The Payment Of Debt Service On The Turtle Bay Reimbursable General Obligation Bonds.
2018.description: Streamlines the process for completing the department of land and natural resources' required annual payment of debt service on the reimbursable general obligation bonds for Turtle Bay. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2022.last_action: Referred to HHH, CPC, referral sheet 3
2022.title: Relating To Methadone Treatment Programs.
2022.description: Amends chapter 329, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to require the medical director of a methadone treatment program to conduct a medical evaluation that offers testing for Hepatitis C exposure and infection. Requires that a methadone treatment program have policies and procedures in place for screening and referrals to care and curative treatment.

2024.last_action: Referred to CPC, JHA, referral sheet 3
2024.title: Relating To The Uniform Controlled Substances Act Mandatory Reporting.
2024.description: Creates a new section under chapter 329, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to require the holder of a controlled substances registration to immediately report orally the theft, embezzlement, fraud, or diversion of a controlled substance in the holder's inventory. Requires the submission of a written report to the administrator of the Narcotics Enforcement Division that provides all information related to the theft, embezzlement, fraud, or diversion of controlled substances in the holder's inventory, including but not limited to, records, reports, and any image, film, video, or other electronic medium. Establishes a misdemeanor penalty for a person who prevents another from reporting, or who knowingly fails to provide information as required.

2026.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott excused (1).
2026.title: Relating To The Workers' Compensation Law.
2026.description: Amends the title of chapter 386, part V, subpart C, Hawaii Revised Statutes (HRS), to add reserve public safety law enforcement officers. Amends the workers' compensation law to include reserve public safety law enforcement officers to the list of covered volunteer occupations. Allows reserve public safety law enforcement officers who are injured under the conditions specified in section 386-3, HRS, to receive workers' compensation. Adds reserve public safety law enforcement officers to the list of volunteers who are covered under the conditions for computing average weekly wages. Effective 12/25/2040. (HD1)

2027.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McKelvey excused (1).
2027.title: Relating To Conformity To The Internal Revenue Code.
2027.description: Conforms Hawaii income and estate and generation-skipping transfer tax laws to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended as of December 31, 2021.

2028.last_action: Report adopted; referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Eli, Kapela excused (2).
2028.title: Relating To The State Taxation Board Of Review.
2028.description: Authorizes the members of the State Taxation Board of Review to validate the board's actions with a concurrence of the majority of members who heard the appeal. Clarifies that board meetings are contested case hearings and provides notice requirements. Clarifies the legal and evidentiary framework the board may use in reaching its decisions. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD1)

2029.last_action: The committee on WAM deferred the measure.
2029.title: Relating To State Tax Administration.
2029.description: Expands the department of taxation's authority to require electronic filings. Requires certain tax return preparers to file returns electronically. Repeals the authorization to require electronic funds transfer or electronic filing if the federal government required that person to file or pay electronically. Removes the timeliness requirement from the electronic funds transfer penalty. Removes the authority of the department of taxation to charge for certified copies of tax clearances. Clarifies tax clearances for liquor license holders. Increases the aggregate cap on late filing penalties. Adds an additional penalty category for late filing of certain informational returns where no tax is due. Clarifies the interest calculations for taxes paid pending appeal. Provides that a partnership, estate, or trust is liable for the required withholding from a nonresident taxpayer's distributive share of income. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD2)

2030.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with Representative(s) Okimoto voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Eli, Kapela excused (2).
2030.title: Relating To Tax Expenditure Accountability.
2030.description: Requires laws that enact, modify, or extend the availability of a tax expenditure to contain specific information, revenue estimates, and analyses before becoming law. Allows the disclosure of certain tax expenditure information. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD2)

2031.title: Relating To Collection Of Delinquent Taxes.
2031.description: Authorizes the Director of Taxation to apply to the circuit court to convert certain tax liens into enforceable civil judgments. (SD1)

2035.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with Representative(s) Tam voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott excused (1).
2035.title: Relating To The Procurement Of Professional Services.
2035.description: Allows a purchasing agency to submit a request for alternative procurement approval from the chief procurement officer or chief procurement officer's designee if less than three qualified persons respond to a solicitation. Effective 7/1/2112. (HD1)

2036.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McKelvey excused (1).
2036.title: Making An Emergency Appropriation To The Department Of Transportation.
2036.description: Makes an emergency appropriation to authorize additional funds for the Department of Transportation Highways Division's special maintenance program.

2037.title: Relating To University Of Hawaii Revenue Bonds.
2037.description: Authorizes the University of Hawaii to issue an unspecified amount in revenue bonds for the purpose of financing the construction, maintenance, and modernization of qualifying capital improvement projects. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2039.last_action: Report adopted; referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McKelvey excused (1).
2039.title: Relating To The University Of Hawaii Board Of Regents.
2039.description: Changes the number of terms of University of Hawaii Board of Regent members that should expire each year from three to two. Adjusts the terms of members appointed between 2022-2026 to realign the number of terms scheduled to expire each year. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2044.last_action: Referred to HHH, JHA, referral sheet 3
2044.title: Relating To Coercive Control.
2044.description: Adds coercive control to the factors a court may consider in determining the best interest of the child.

2045.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
2045.title: Relating To The Early Childhood Registry.
2045.description: Requires the staff of licensed and registered early childhood programs to annually provide specific information to the Department of Human Services' Early Childhood Workforce Registry. Requires a report to the Legislature. Makes an appropriation. Effective 7/1/2060. (HD1)

2046.last_action: The committee(s) on WAL recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2046.title: Relating To Golf Courses And Driving Ranges.
2046.description: Makes owners and operators of golf courses and driving ranges strictly liable for property damage to surrounding residential properties caused by golf balls hit by patrons of the golf course or driving range unless the owners and operators can show they took reasonable steps to prevent golf balls from leaving the golf course or driving range.

2048.title: Relating To Stream Maintenance.
2048.description: Requires the department of land and natural resources to establish and implement a two-year stream maintenance reimbursement pilot program to reimburse homeowners for clearing debris in and around streams near their property. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2050.last_action: Referred to WAL, JHA, referral sheet 3
2050.title: Relating To Commercial Activities On Beaches.
2050.description: Prohibits any person from presetting commercial beach equipment on beaches encumbered with easements in favor of the public.

2051.title: Relating To Fishponds.
2051.description: Appropriates funds to support the department of land and natural resources in restoring and restocking fishponds. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2052.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Tokioka excused (1).
2052.title: Relating To Biosecurity.
2052.description: Appropriates funds to continue the ports-of-entry biosecurity program. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2053.last_action: Referred to HHH, CPC, referral sheet 3
2053.title: Relating To Noise.
2053.description: Prohibits commercial vehicles from making pickups from, or deliveries to, business establishments during certain times of the day and within a certain proximity of single-family residences in the performance of the vehicles' pickup or delivery. Establishes fines.

2054.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JHA with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McKelvey excused (1).
2054.title: Relating To State Symbols.
2054.description: Designates ohia lehua as the state endemic tree. Effective 7/1/2044. (HD1)

2055.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
2055.title: Relating To The Issuance Of Special Purpose Revenue Bonds To Assist Dibshawaii Llc.
2055.description: Authorizes the issuance of special purpose revenue bonds to assist DIBSHawaii LLC in the construction of a net zero carbon capture storage utilization platform that will recover vented carbon dioxide emissions and scrub them into food grade liquid carbon dioxide. Effective 7/1/2100. (HD1)

2056.last_action: Referred to HHH, CPC, JHA, referral sheet 3
2056.title: Relating To Midwives.
2056.description: Exempts traditional midwives from midwifery licensing requirements.

2057.last_action: Referred to HHH, CPC, referral sheet 3
2057.title: Relating To Certificates Of Need.
2057.description: Eliminates the certificate of need requirement for all health care facilities and health care services except for nursing homes, hospices, intermediate care facilities for the intellectually disabled, and ambulance service providers.

2058.last_action: Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 872).
2058.title: Relating To An Appropriation For The University Of Hawaii.
2058.description: Appropriates funds to the University of Hawaii at Manoa for athletics, provided that the Board of Regents considers fiscal matters pertaining to coaching contracts and the termination of certain athletic personnel for cause. Appropriates funds to University of Hawaii at Hilo for athletics. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

2059.last_action: Referred to WAL/AGR, FIN, referral sheet 3
2059.title: Relating To Feral Pigs.
2059.description: Appropriates funds to the Department of Agriculture for feral pig control.

2061.last_action: The committee(s) on HHH recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2061.title: Relating To Domestic Abuse.
2061.description: Specifies that any minor who resides in the same household as the victim of domestic abuse may file a petition for an order of protection or temporary restraining order.

2062.last_action: Referred to HHH, CPC, JHA, referral sheet 3
2062.title: Relating To Abortion Care.
2062.description: Clarifies that access to abortion care is inclusive of all pregnant people in the State. Repeals a criminal penalty for violations of certain abortion provisions. Clarifies that advanced practice registered nurses may provide abortion care.

2063.last_action: Referred to HHH, JHA, referral sheet 3
2063.title: Relating To Family.
2063.description: Establishes an exemption from mediation in paternity proceedings where there are allegations of domestic abuse. Amends the exemption from mediation in divorce proceedings by disallowing mediation when there are allegations of domestic violence.

2064.last_action: The committee(s) on HSG recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2064.title: Relating To Affordable Housing And Homeownership Incentives.
2064.description: Implementation of IRS pre-tax savings plans to assist first time home buyers with saving for down payment and closing costs.

2065.title: Relating To Mail Theft.
2065.description: Establishes the misdemeanor offense of theft of mail. (SD1)

2066.last_action: Referred to HHH, JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
2066.title: Relating To The Social Workers For Public Safety Pilot Program For Impaired Offenders.
2066.description: Establishes a pilot program in the department of public safety to hire five social workers to accompany officers on incidents involving persons that may suffer from substance addiction, mental illness, homelessness, or other catastrophic afflictions. Appropriates funds.

2067.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on ECD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott excused (1).
2067.title: Relating To Tax Credit For On-site Early Childhood Facilities.
2067.description: Establishes an income tax credit for employers who create on-site early childhood facilities, to be applicable to taxable years beginning after 12/31/2022. Establishes and appropriates funds for an on-site early childhood facility coordinator position. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2070.last_action: Received notice of change in conferees (Hse. Com. No. 800).
2070.title: Relating To The Frank T. Okimoto Reef Runway.
2070.description: Designates as the Frank T. Okimoto Reef Runway the reef runway at the Daniel K. Inouye International Airport. (SD1)

2072.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2072.title: Relating To Nursing.
2072.description: Appropriates funds to the University of Hawaii to increase the State's capacity to train new nurses and project future nursing workforce needs. Provides that the nursing program at the University of Hawaii, West Oahu be reinstated as a condition to the appropriation. Effective 7/1/2055. (SD1)

2073.last_action: Referred to HHH, HET, FIN, referral sheet 3
2073.title: Relating To The Nursing Workforce.
2073.description: Appropriates funds to support Hawaii's nursing workforce and address the nursing workforce shortage by increasing University of Hawaii nursing faculty positions, providing education grants to qualified students who represent underrepresented persons in nursing, and providing greater training and development for nurses.

2074.last_action: Referred to JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
2074.title: Relating To The District Courts.
2074.description: Increases the monetary threshold for claims over which the district courts have jurisdiction from $40,000 to $60,000.

2077.last_action: Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 718).
2077.title: Relating To Hawaii Technology Development Corporation.
2077.description: Appropriates funds to the Hawaii technology development corporation for its grant programs. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

2078.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McKelvey excused (1).
2078.title: Relating To The Tax Credit For Research Activities.
2078.description: Adds a cap for an eligible taxpayer and the taxpayer's related entities per taxable year for the tax credit for research activities. Consolidates the survey and certification requirements. Amends the annual aggregate cap. Requires certification on a first-come, first-served basis to be based on the date a complete application is received, subject to certain conditions, for the tax credit. (HD1)

2079.last_action: The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2079.title: Relating To The "made In Hawaii" Program.
2079.description: Transfers the enforcement of the "Made in Hawaii" trademark from the department of agriculture to the department of commerce and consumer affairs. Renames the "Hawaii Made" program the "Made in Hawaii" program. Appropriates funds. (HD1)

2080.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) D. Kobayashi voting no (1) and Representative(s) Eli, Kapela excused (2).
2080.title: Relating To Film Infrastructure Tax Credit.
2080.description: Creates a nonrefundable twenty percent film infrastructure tax credit. Requires that the film infrastructure project must spend an unspecified amount on buildings, facilities, or installations. Caps the credit at an unspecified amount per year. Effective 10/18/2050. (HD1)

2081.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2081.title: Relating To Coastal Erosion.
2081.description: Establishes and appropriates funds for a two-year program at the University of Hawaii, College of Engineering to study the impact of sandbag walls, or "sand burritos", on sand movement patterns and coastal erosion and on public trust resources, including beach access, coastal water quality, and recreation, at Ehukai Beach Park; including from the shoreline area near Ke Ike road to Sunset beach. Requires a report to the legislature before the Regular Session of 2025. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

2085.title: Relating To Temporary Assistance For Needy Families.
2085.description: Authorizes the Department of Human Services to provide additional housing assistance subsidies of up to $500 per month to Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) and Temporary Assistance for Other Needy Families (TAONF) program participants who are participating in the First-To-Work program. (SD2)

2092.title: Relating To Other Post-employment Benefits.
2092.description: Authorizes the issuance of general obligation bonds to pay or prepay the State's other post-employment benefits liability under certain conditions. Requires that the outstanding balance of general obligation bonds issued to pay or prepay the other post-employment benefits liability to be considered in the calculation of public employers' annual required contribution to the other post-employment benefits trust fund. (CD1)

2094.last_action: Referred to HHH, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
2094.title: Relating To Fertility Preservation.
2094.description: Requires insurers, mutual benefit societies, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for fertility preservation procedures for those who have been diagnosed with cancer and whose cancer or cancer treatment may adversely affect their fertility.

2096.last_action: Referred to HET, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
2096.title: Relating To The Hawaii Public Wireless Safety Act.
2096.description: Establishes the Hawaii Public Wireless Safety Act to be administered by the Department of Commerce and Consumer Affairs.

2097.last_action: Referred to EEP/LAT, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
2097.title: Relating To Natural Resource Management.
2097.description: Establishes within the Department of Land and Natural Resources a visitor green fee program to collect a fee to allow visitors to visit a state park, beach, state-owned forest, hiking trail, or other state-owned natural area. Establishes the environmental legacy commission to allocate the revenues from the visitor green to protect and manage Hawaii's natural resources. Appropriates moneys.

2098.title: Relating To The State Highway Enforcement Program Surcharge.
2098.description: Amends the state highway enforcement program surcharge from $200 to an unspecified amount. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2100.title: Relating To Schools.
2100.description: Amends the definition of "private schools" under the compulsory attendance law to require unlicensed but accredited private schools to annually submit health and safety documentation to the Hawaii Council of Private Schools or the Hawaii Catholic Schools office. (SD2)

2101.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Tokioka excused (1).
2101.title: Relating To Menstrual Equality.
2101.description: Requires DOE to provide hygiene products that support public health, such as toilet paper, menstrual products, and hand soap free of charge to all students on all public school campuses. Requires the state public charter school commission to provide hygiene products that support public health, such as toilet paper, menstrual products, and hand soap free of charge to all students on all public charter school campuses. Makes appropriations. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2105.last_action: The committee(s) on FIN recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2105.title: Relating To International Sister-state Relations.
2105.description: Appropriates funds to support international sister-state relations. Effective 7/1/2044. (HD1)

2106.last_action: The committee(s) on WAL recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2106.title: Relating To Native Hawaiian Sailing Canoes.
2106.description: Amends requirements for an owner or lessee of a native Hawaiian sailing canoe to moor at a small boat harbor. Defines "native Hawaiian sailing canoe".

2109.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JHA with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Luke, McDermott excused (2).
2109.title: Relating To Reentry Planning Circles.
2109.description: Appropriates moneys to fund reentry planning circles for incarcerated women. Effective 7/1/3000. (HD1)

2111.last_action: Referred to CMV/HHH, JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
2111.title: Relating To Assistance For Persons Completing A Term Of Imprisonment.
2111.description: Establishes within the Department of Human Services a 4-year pilot program to provide housing and child care vouchers to qualified applicants who will soon complete, or have recently completed, a term of imprisonment as a sentenced offender, and who have or will have sole or primary custody of 1 or more children under the age of 18. Requires a voucher recipient to be employed at least 20 hours per week or be employed and attend an educational program for a combined total of at least 20 hours per week. Requires reports to the Legislature. Appropriates moneys.

2114.last_action: The committee(s) on WAL recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2114.title: Relating To Water Rationing.
2114.description: Establishes an income tax credit for water rationing systems.

2115.last_action: Referred to WAL/EEP/HHH, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
2115.title: Relating To Water Quality Management.
2115.description: Facilitates the jurisdiction transfer of water quality management, water pollution, wastewater treatment, instream flow standards, and applications for water quality from the Department of Health to the Commission on Water Resource Management.

2118.last_action: Referred to EEP, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
2118.title: Relating To State Building Construction.
2118.description: Requires all state building construction that uses concrete to use post-industrial carbon dioxide mineralized concrete unless use of these materials will increase costs or delay construction.

2122.last_action: Referred to WAL, JHA, referral sheet 3
2122.title: Relating To The Board Of Land And Natural Resources.
2122.description: Requires at least 1 member of the Board of Land and Natural Resources to have demonstrated knowledge of, and experience with, the State's boating and fishing communities, including knowledge of ocean conservation and traditional fishing rights. Requires the member representing the boating and fishing communities to be recommended by a statewide fishing organization for the Governor's nomination and appointment.

2123.last_action: Referred to HSG, JHA, referral sheet 3
2123.title: Relating To Assistance Animals.
2123.description: Defines "assistance animal" for purposes of the State's fair housing laws. Clarifies the type of verification a person with a disability must provide to request an assistance animal as a reasonable housing accommodation.

2126.last_action: The committee on AEN deferred the measure.
2126.title: Relating To Underground Fuel Storage Tanks.
2126.description: Prohibits the issuance of future large capacity underground fuel storage tanks mauka of the applicable underground injection control line. Prohibits the operation of and renewal of permits for large capacity underground fuel storage tank permits located mauka of the applicable underground injection control line beginning 1/1/2045. Effective 7/1/2060. (HD2)

2131.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Twenty-fourth Representative District.
2131.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the twenty-fourth representative district.

2134.title: Relating To Association Fees.
2134.description: Requires the breakdown of the annual maintenance fees in developer's public reports to include annual reserve contributions based on a reserve study. Redefines "cash flow plan" to mean a minimum thirty-year projection of a condominium association's future income and expense requirements to fund fully its replacement reserves requirements each year, except for emergencies.

2135.last_action: Referred to JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
2135.title: Relating To Small Claims.
2135.description: Establishes district court ombudsman to assist the small claims division. Declares agreements establishing forums for actions within the jurisdiction of the small claims division to be contrary to public policy and void and unenforceable. Raises the monetary cap for claims under the small claims division's jurisdiction. Expands the small claims division's allowable equitable remedies.

2136.title: Relating To Equitable Distribution Of Grow Our Own Resources For Hawaiian Immersion Teachers.
2136.description: Establishes a stipend program to be administered by DOE for students enrolled in a teacher education program at UH and who agree to teach in the public school system for five years. Establishes a similar stipend program to be administered by the state public charter school commission for students enrolled in a teacher education program at UH and who agree to teach in a public charter school for five years. Gives preference to teachers who choose to teach in a Hawaiian immersion school. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2138.last_action: Referred to HHH, JHA, referral sheet 3
2138.title: Relating To Marriage Of Minors.
2138.description: Raises the minimum age for marriage from 16 to 18 years of age. Removes the requirements of parental consent and written approval by the family court for a minor to marry. Removes spousal cohabitation after the parties attain legal age as an exception for an annulment based on nonage. Makes conforming amendments.

2139.last_action: Referred to CPC, JHA, referral sheet 3
2139.title: Relating To Virtual Currency.
2139.description: Excludes the electronic transfer of virtual currency through virtual currency companies and cryptocurrency companies from the Money Transmitters Act.

2141.last_action: Referred to CAI/HHH, JHA, referral sheet 3
2141.title: Relating To Disability Awareness.
2141.description: Designates the month of October as "Disability Awareness Month: Employment, Enrichment, and Inclusion" in recognition of the employment challenges and successes of persons with disabilities in the State.

2147.last_action: Referred to HHH, EDN, JHA, referral sheet 3
2147.title: Relating To Parental Rights.
2147.description: Establishes rights of parents and legal guardians of minor children to direct the upbringing, education, health care, and mental health of their minor child.

2149.last_action: Referred to PDP, EEP, CPC, referral sheet 3
2149.title: Relating To Wastewater Treatment Facilities.
2149.description: Establishes criteria by which a county director of wastewater treatment systems can determine catastrophic failure of existing wastewater treatment facilities. Authorizes county governments to enter into private-public partnerships to fund, design, build, and operate new wastewater treatment and resource recovery facilities in the event of catastrophic failure. Allows each county to contract certain services in certain cases to prevent catastrophic failure of existing wastewater treatment facilities. Amends the definition of "resource recovery facility" to encompass other resources such as reusable water or recoverable gas.

2150.last_action: Referred to EEP/WAL, FIN, referral sheet 3
2150.title: Relating To Wastewater Treatment Improvements In The County Of Hawaii.
2150.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds for replacements to the water capturing system in the Hilo Water Treatment Plant to capture recycled water, natural gases, and fertilizer for agricultural purposes.

2151.last_action: Referred to CPC, JHA, referral sheet 3
2151.title: Relating To The Prosecuting Attorney.
2151.description: Makes technical amendments to nuisance abatement law.

2154.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
2154.title: Relating To The University Of Hawaii Sea Grant College Program.
2154.description: Appropriates moneys for the continued operation and disaster preparedness outreach efforts of the University of Hawaii sea grant college program. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2155.title: Relating To The Uniform Information Practices Act.
2155.description: Clarifies the legislature's intent regarding internal deliberative and pre-decisional materials of government agencies. Specifies that certain deliberative and pre-decisional materials that are a direct part of a government agency's internal decision-making process are not subject to disclosure if the disclosure of such materials would impair the agency's ability to make sound and fair decisions, but only to the extent that the impairment outweighs public interest in disclosure. Effective 7/1/2112. (HD1)

2156.title: Relating To The Farm To School Program.
2156.description: Appropriates funds to the DOE to secure additional resources to help implement the Hawaii farm to school program, specifically to implement internal systems and controls to meet the State's local food goals in school meals. Requires the DOE to submit a report to the legislature no later than 1/1/2023 that details a plan and timeline for implementing the Hawaii farm to school program. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2162.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JHA with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Luke, McDermott excused (2).
2162.title: Relating To Recidivism Prevention.
2162.description: Establishes within the judiciary a five-year recidivism prevention pilot program consisting of three components: a housing voucher program, child care voucher program, and income tax credit for employers to assist the reentry efforts of certain individuals who exited the Women's Community Correctional Center, for two years after the exit. Establishes five transition navigator positions within the judiciary. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/3000. Repeals 7/1/27. (HD1)

2163.last_action: Report adopted; referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Eli, Kapela excused (2).
2163.title: Relating To Native Hawaiian Rehabilitation Programs.
2163.description: Requires the department of public safety, in collaboration with the office of Hawaiian affairs, to create a Native Hawaiian rehabilitation program for prison inmates that puts an emphasis on preserving Native Hawaiian values and cultural practices. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/3000. (HD1)

2164.title: Relating To Prison Reform.
2164.description: Establishes the women's corrections implementation commission in the judiciary to ensure implementation of the recommendations from the final report of the House Concurrent Resolution No. 85 (2016) task force, to develop and implement an evidence-based, gender-responsive plan to divert non-violent women offenders, especially those with minor children, from the criminal justice system. Requires the commission to consider model programs including residential, in-person and community-based rehabilitation programs, supportive and subsidized housing, restorative justice, and educational programs. (CD1)

2165.last_action: The committee(s) on FIN recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2165.title: Relating To Risk And Needs Assessment For Female Offenders.
2165.description: Requires the department of public safety to develop a pretrial female risk and needs assessment tool and conduct internal pretrial female risk and needs assessments to measure the female offender's risk of flight, criminal conduct, or harm to the community. Requires the pretrial female risk and needs assessment tool to consider factors important to women when considering their risk to reoffend and treatment needs. Effective 7/1/3000. (HD1)

2166.last_action: Referred to HHH, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
2166.title: Relating To Certificates Of Participation.
2166.description: Prohibits the Director of Finance from issuing or approving any certificate of participation that exceeds $10 million.

2167.last_action: Referred to HHH, JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
2167.title: Relating To Youth.
2167.description: Establishes a grant program within the Office of Youth Services. Gives priority to programs that support youth from ethnic groups that are disproportionately represented in the State's correctional system, support rehabilitation, or meet needs identified by the Office of Youth Services in consultation with the community. Appropriates moneys.

2168.last_action: Referred to HHH/EEP, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
2168.title: Relating To The Red Hill Bulk Fuel Storage Facility Defueling Commission.
2168.description: Establishes within the Department of Health a temporary Red Hill Bulk Fuel Storage Facility Defueling Commission to monitor the compliance of the United States Department of Defense or other agencies with any orders or laws relating to the Red Hill Bulk Fuel Storage Facility or United States Department of Defense infrastructure involved in the 2021 drinking water contamination event. Establishes a Red Hill Compliance Office to support the Commission. Appropriates moneys. Sunsets on 6/30/2027.

2169.last_action: Referred to WAL/CMV/EEP, JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
2169.title: Relating To The Leasing Of Public Lands By The Military.
2169.description: Establishes duration, environmental, and other restrictions on public lands leased to the military.

2170.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
2170.title: Relating To Mental Health Licensing.
